item.title: Inside Our Car Hacking Demonstrator
item.author: max.randhahn@yahoo.de (Max)
item.description: Introduction # Over the past year, we’ve developed a cutting-edge car hacking demonstrator primarily for internal training purposes.

item.title: CORS Misconfiguration to Account Takeover
item.author: max.randhahn@yahoo.de (Max)
item.description: During an assesment, I uncovered a chain of exploits that began with a CORS misconfiguration and culminated in an account takeover / authentication bypass via XPath injection in an API endpoint.

item.title: Introduction to Cache Poisoning Attacks
item.author: max.randhahn@yahoo.de (Max)
item.description: Terminology # Keyed Parameters # Keyed parameters are parameters that the cache system considers when storing and retrieving cached content.

item.title: Reflected XSS to Account Takeover
item.author: max.randhahn@yahoo.de (Max)
item.description: The Vulnerabillity # When researching an application, I noticed that there was a feature for resetting the email address of our user.

item.title: Introduction to NoSQL Injection Attacks
item.author: max.randhahn@yahoo.de (Max)
item.description: Overview # NoSQL databases like MongoDB, Couchbase, and Cassandra have gained immense popularity due to their flexibility, scalability, and performance benefits over traditional relational databases.
